html:
earth mourneth and languisheth. The earth mourns and languishes as a reaction to the wickedness of her peoples. To languish is to become weak or feeble. This language is also used by Isaiah in 24:4.

Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down. Isaiah uses symbolic language to express the destruction of fruitful fields and productive forests (32:15), symbolizing the proud and the wealthy, who will be ashamed and hewn down at the last day. It is apparent from 10:33-34 that Jehovah is the forester who hews down Lebanon (2:12-13).
